page.title: 04Local History - Language
page.content: Origins of place names in the area:- Harborne is mentioned in the Domesday Book as Horeborne. Ridgacre appears in record of AD 1271 as Rugacre or Rugaker and again as Rugeacre in 1500.It probably means Â£ploughed land on the ridge'. World's End, so called because it was a remote & lonely place. Tom Prestein states in his History of Harborne that the field path from Mockbeggar came to an abrupt end here by a cottage & garden. Tom Knocker's Wood once a remote and pleasant place in which one might be undisturbed all day, named either after a hermit who committed suicide or a highway man who was hanged for his crimes. This haunted wood once stood between Northfield Road and the allotments on Tennal Lane.
